create.logic_gauge.gate.or: OR (Activate if any inputs are active)
create.logic_gauge.gate.and: AND (Activate if all inputs are active)
create.logic_gauge.gate.nor: NOR (Activate if all inputs are inactive)
create.logic_gauge.gate.nand: NAND (Activate if any inputs are inactive)
create.logic_gauge.gate.xor: XOR (Activate if active inputs are odd)
create.logic_gauge.gate.xnor: XNOR (Activate if active inputs are even)
create.gui.logic_gauge.title: Connection Settings
create.factory_panel.custom_panel_on_res: Cannot put custom gauges on packager
create.integer_gauge.mode.subtract: SUBTRACT (Sums all inputs but gives negative result)
create.comparator_gauge.mode.greater_equ: Input is greater than or equals Value
create.comparator_gauge.mode.less_equals: Input is less than or equals Value
create.logistics.comparator_gauge.title: Â§lInputs will be summed
extra_gauges.ponder.logic_gauge.header: Using Logic Gauges to read redstone signals
extra_gauges.ponder.logic_gauge.text_1: Logic Gauges can read redstone information from panel elements...
extra_gauges.ponder.logic_gauge.text_2: And transmit it over to other panel elements
extra_gauges.ponder.logic_gauge.text_3: Connections between elements can be created via the + button in the GUI by right-clicking the gauge
extra_gauges.ponder.logic_gauge.text_4: Logic operations (OR, AND, NOR, NAND, XOR, XNOR) can be changed by holding right-click
extra_gauges.ponder.logic_gauge.text_5: The logic gate, now in AND mode, will output redstone only if all links are active
extra_gauges.ponder.integer_gauge_redsto: Using Integer Gauges to read redstone signals
Integer Gauges can read integer information from panel elements...
And transmit it over to other panel elements, after summing them up
Connections between elements can be created via the + button in the GUI by right-clicking the gauge
Mathematical operations (+, -, x) can be changed by holding right-click on the gauge
extra_gauges.ponder.integer_gauge_factor: Using Integer Gauges to read Factory Gauges
Integer Gauges can read integer information from Factory Gauges...
And transmit it over to other panel elements, after summing them up
extra_gauges.ponder.counter_gauge.header: Using Counter Gauges to read redstone signals
extra_gauges.ponder.counter_gauge.text_1: Counter Gauges can count the number of redstone inputs...
extra_gauges.ponder.counter_gauge.text_2: And transmit it over to other panel elements
extra_gauges.ponder.counter_gauge.text_3: Connections between elements can be created via the + button in the GUI by right-clicking the gauge
extra_gauges.ponder.counter_gauge.text_4: The counter threshold can be changed by holding right-click
extra_gauges.ponder.counter_gauge.text_5: Once the threshold is reached (in this example it's 3), the counter will output redstone power
extra_gauges.ponder.counter_gauge.text_6: Triggering the counter another time will reset it to 0
extra_gauges.ponder.comparator_gauge_red: Using Comparator Gauges to read redstone signals
Comparator Gauges can read numerical information from panel elements, sum them up...
And transmit the result of the comparison (in this case "input signal = 15") to other panel elements
Connections between elements can be created via the + button in the GUI by right-clicking the gauge
The comparing value can be changed by holding right-click
extra_gauges.ponder.comparator_gauge_fac: Using Comparator Gauges to read Factory Gauges
Comparator Gauges can read numerical information from Factory Gauges...
And transmit the result of the comparison (in this case "input signal = 96") to other panel elements
